column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/its-not-just-glaring/|“It’s Not Just Glaring”|The Bucs have needs
column3: but how urgent are they? A guy who knows the Bucs extraordinarily well doesn’t seem to be losing sleep about the Bucs’ need at edge rusher as Joe does every night after running head first into blunt objects. Joe is referring to SiriusXM NFL Radio draft guru Mark Dominik
column4: the man who preceded Jason Licht as Bucs GM. He was on the air today talking to a fan caller who essentially said the Bucs need a quality body on every position on defense. Dominik told the guy it’s not as bad as he made it sound. “You’re on point for the most part … I think you’re right; I think they’re fairly balanced
column8: ” Dominik said of Tampa Bay’s needs. Dominik added that he thinks the Bucs are in good shape and can kind of get off the edge of their seat and not freak out in the draft. “Glaring
column10: is in the eye of the beholder. Joe can see how some Bucs observers could not think the Bucs are in panic mode when it comes to their defense. However
column11: Joe would sit those folks down and make them watch the last two Bucs-Falcons game. The best potential news from Dominik was his assertion that he believes Lavonte David will not retire in 2025. Keep in mind Dominik drafted David
column12: has him as a radio guest and Dominik has guys he hired still employed at One Buc Palace. The silence surrounding David’s status has been ominous
column13: so Joe was grateful to hear Dominik weigh in.|2025-03-07 16:36:00|271|32|8|Mark Dominik|Bucs' draft needs not overwhelmingly urgent.|4|Mixed opinions on players
column15: and team prospects despite some optimism.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""ballwasher61""

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/harold-landry-set-free/|Harold Landry Set Free|A pass rusher just broke free of his loser team’s chains today. And Joe knows a team that could really
column2: really use him. The Titans cut loose outside linebacker Harold Landry
column3: reports Nick Suss of The Tennessean. It was because
column5: Landry’s cap hit would have been a massive $24 million. So now Landry
column7: is a free man. What is Bucs AC/DC-loving general manager Jason Licht going to do about it? Licht no longer has to trade a coveted draft pick for an edge rusher. All Licht has to do is order his right-hand man Mike Greenberg to find a way to get a Landry salary to work. That’s what Greenberg gets paid to do. And he does it very well. In his last three seasons of play (Landry missed the 2022 season with a blown ACL)

column3: the Bucs were p!ss poor running the ball. Dead-last in the NFL two years running

column6: No. 15 from No. 32 is a pretty big jump. Expecting a run game to improve more than that in one season is

column9: raising their dormant run game to No. 4 in the NFL. Unreal! Appearing on the Barstool Sports podcast “Pardon My Take” with co-hosts Big Cat and PFT Commenter
column10: Coen gave major props to Bucs players saying they all bought in to what he preached and embraced playing “FAST.” Coen said the acronym embodied what he wanted the offense to be. column11: ” Coen said. “That’s where it stems. The mentally and physically tough part is what we really want to talk about. “We go into Tampa this year
column12: they had the 32nd-ranked run game in the NFL in the last two seasons. And we go in and bring it to No. 4. “It was buy-in. It was all about toughness. It was physicality

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/bspn-underrated-ben-bredeson/|BSPN: “Underrated” Ben Bredeson|Just gauging the comments on this here corner of the interwebs
column2: more than a few Bucs fans want the team to wash its hands of left guard Ben Bredeson. Joe doesn’t get this. At all. The Bucs had one of the better offensive lines in the game blocking for one of the best quarterbacks
column3: one of the best passing offenses and one of the best running attacks. Where exactly is the evidence that Bredeson is dragging the team down? Ben Solak of BSPN thinks Bredeson is an “underrated” free agent. He seems to imply Bucs fans will miss him if he jumps off the pirate ship next week in free agency. In fact
column4: Solak thinks the Chargers will be in play for Bredeson. Why? Well
column5: Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh recruited the Michigan Man at Michigan
column6: coached Bredeson at Michigan and the team Harbaugh currently coaches needs guards. Buccaneers G Ben Bredeson: The left guard was unspectacular but rock solid on a one-year deal this past season
column7: and will look to leverage that into a multiyear extension somewhere. Bredeson has played on both sides of the line
column8: which will increase his value for teams with multiple open spots. It’s worth noting he played for Jim Harbaugh at Michigan and was drafted by John Harbaugh’s Ravens when Greg Roman was offensive coordinator. The Chargers need some guards. What Solak wasn’t specific about is that Roman
column9: the offensive coordinator who worked with Bredeson as a rookie
